TITLE: Implementing a Secure SAXParserFactory in Java for Play Framework
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet provides a custom SAXParserFactory implementation that disables XML external entities to mitigate the XXE vulnerability. It creates a wrapper around the platform default SAXParserFactory and disables external-general-entities and doctype declarations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/vulnerabilities/20130911-XmlExternalEntity.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
package xml;

import org.xml.sax.*;
import javax.xml.parsers.*;

public class SecureSAXParserFactory extends SAXParserFactory {
    private final SAXParserFactory platformDefault = new com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.SAXParserFactoryImpl();

    public SecureSAXParserFactory() throws SAXNotSupportedException, SAXNotRecognizedException, ParserConfigurationException {
        platformDefault.setFeature("http://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities", false);
        platformDefault.setFeature("http://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl", true);
    }

    public SAXParser newSAXParser() throws ParserConfigurationException, SAXException {
        return platformDefault.newSAXParser();
    }

    public void setFeature(String name, boolean value) throws ParserConfigurationException, SAXNotRecognizedException, SAXNotSupportedException {
        platformDefault.setFeature(name, value);
    }

    public boolean getFeature(String name) throws ParserConfigurationException, SAXNotRecognizedException, SAXNotSupportedException {
        return platformDefault.getFeature(name);
    }
}
```

TITLE: Java XML Parsing Security Workaround
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to securely parse XML using DocumentBuilderFactory instead of vulnerable play.libs.XML API. Follows OWASP security recommendations for preventing XXE attacks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/vulnerabilities/CVE-2014-3630-XmlExternalEntity.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
DocumentBuilderFactory dbf = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
// Disable XML external entity processing
```

TITLE: Implementing Secure SAXParserFactory in Java for Play Framework
DESCRIPTION: This Java class provides a secure SAXParserFactory implementation that disables XML external entities to mitigate the vulnerability. It extends SAXParserFactory and disables external-general-entities, external-parameter-entities, and disallows doctype declarations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/vulnerabilities/20130920-XmlExternalEntity.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
package xml;

import org.xml.sax.*;
import javax.xml.parsers.*;

public class SecureSAXParserFactory extends SAXParserFactory {
    private final SAXParserFactory platformDefault = new com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.SAXParserFactoryImpl();

    public SecureSAXParserFactory() throws SAXNotSupportedException, SAXNotRecognizedException, ParserConfigurationException {
        platformDefault.setFeature("http://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities", false);
        platformDefault.setFeature("http://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities", false);
        platformDefault.setFeature("http://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl", true);
    }

    public SAXParser newSAXParser() throws ParserConfigurationException, SAXException {
        return platformDefault.newSAXParser();
    }

    public void setFeature(String name, boolean value) throws ParserConfigurationException, SAXNotRecognizedException, SAXNotSupportedException {
        platformDefault.setFeature(name, value);
    }

    public boolean getFeature(String name) throws ParserConfigurationException, SAXNotRecognizedException, SAXNotSupportedException {
        return platformDefault.getFeature(name);
    }
}
```

TITLE: Securing JavaScript Router with Explicit Host in Play Framework
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the secure implementation of JavaScriptReverseRouter by explicitly setting a sanitized host value instead of relying on the default Host header. Includes route configuration for Users.list and Application.index with jQuery ajax method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/vulnerabilities/20160622-JavaScriptRouterXSS.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: scala
CODE:
```
@Html(play.api.routing.JavaScriptReverseRouter(
  name = "Router",
  ajaxMethod = Some("jQuery.ajax"),
  host = "example.com", // should either be constant or sanitized value
  routes.javascript.Users.list,
  routes.javascript.Application.index
).body.replace("/", "\\/"))
```

TITLE: Configuring CSRF Protection in Play Framework
DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings to be added to application.conf to implement a workaround for the CSRF vulnerability. This configuration forces CSRF checks on all POST requests regardless of content type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/vulnerabilities/20160304-CsrfBypass.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: hocon
CODE:
```
play.filters.csrf.contentType {
  blackList = []
  whiteList = ["none"]
}
```

TITLE: Mitigating XSS Injection in Play Framework URL Rendering (Java)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to mitigate the XSS vulnerability in Play Framework by encoding the parameter before using it in URL rendering. It uses the urlEncode() method to sanitize the input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/vulnerabilities/20150506-XssUrlParamerter.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: java
CODE:
```
@{Controller.action(parameterWithInjection?.urlEncode())}
```

TITLE: Fixing XSS in Play Framework Secure Module Login Template
DESCRIPTION: Code changes required to fix XSS vulnerability in the Secure module login page. Replaces unsafe HTML output with message interpolation using messages.get() for flash error and success messages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/vulnerabilities/20160301-XssSecureModule.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
&{flash.error}
```

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
${messages.get(flash.error)}
```

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
&{flash.success}
```

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
${messages.get(flash.success)}
```

TITLE: Adding Netty Dependency Fix for Play Framework Cookie Vulnerability
DESCRIPTION: SBT dependency configuration to upgrade Netty to version 3.9.8.Final as a workaround for the httpOnly cookie bypass vulnerability (CVE-2015-2156).
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/vulnerabilities/CVE-2015-2156-HttpOnlyBypass.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: scala
CODE:
```
libraryDependencies += "io.netty" % "netty" % "3.9.8.Final"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Logback Dependency in SBT
DESCRIPTION: SBT configuration to upgrade the Logback library to version 1.2.3 to address the deserialization vulnerability. This dependency should be added to the project's build.sbt file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/vulnerabilities/20170407-LogbackDeser.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: scala
CODE:
```
libraryDependencies += "ch.qos.logback" % "logback-classic" % "1.2.3"
```

TITLE: Upgrading HTTPClient Library in Scala for Play Framework Vulnerability Workaround
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to upgrade the HTTPClient library to version 4.5.2 as a workaround for the Play WS OAuth 1.0 denial of service vulnerability. This version of the library does not have the issues present in earlier versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/vulnerabilities/20170120-WSOAuthDoS.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: scala
CODE:
```
libraryDependencies += "org.apache.httpcomponents" % "httpclient" % "4.5.2"
```

TITLE: Displaying CVSS Metrics for CVE-2020-26882 in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the CVSS (Common Vulnerability Scoring System) metrics for the JSON parse data amplification vulnerability in Play Framework. It includes the overall score and a link to the CVSS calculator with the specific vector string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/vulnerabilities/CVE-2020-26882-JsonParseDataAmplification.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
**Overall: 6.7**
[AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:P/RL:O/RC:C](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln-metrics/cvss/v3-calculator?vector=AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H/E:P/RL:O/RC:C&version=3.1)
```

TITLE: SBT Configuration for Pure SBT Watch Service
DESCRIPTION: Configuration to use a pure SBT implementation for file watching in Play's development mode. This setting is added to build.sbt and allows specifying a custom poll interval.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/changelog.md#2025-04-10_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: scala
CODE:
```
PlayKeys.playWatchService := play.sbtplugin.run.PlayWatchService.sbt(pollInterval.value)
```

TITLE: SBT Configuration for JNotify Watch Service
DESCRIPTION: Configuration to use JNotify for file watching in Play's development mode instead of the default JDK7 WatchService. This setting is added to build.sbt.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/changelog.md#2025-04-10_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: scala
CODE:
```
PlayKeys.playWatchService := play.sbtplugin.run.PlayWatchService.jnotify(Keys.sLog.value)
```

TITLE: Setting Up Play Framework Website Server
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands for cloning repositories and setting up the Play Framework website server. This includes cloning the main website repo, documentation repos, and translation repos.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Assuming you are in the $HOME folder
cd ~

# Clone this website repo
git clone -o origin https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com.git

# Install docs and its translation files
mkdir ~/play-docs-translations
cd ~/play-docs-translations
git clone -o origin https://github.com/playframework/play-generated-docs.git generated
git clone -o origin https://github.com/playframework-ja/translation-project.git ja
git clone -o origin https://github.com/PlayFrameworkTR/translation-project tr
git clone -o origin https://github.com/cheleb/playframework-fr fr
git clone -o origin https://github.com/antonsarov/translation-project bg

# Now you need to link the translation files from the ~/playframework.com/data folder:
cd ~/playframework.com/data/
ln -s ../../play-docs-translations/generated generated

# This should not be necessary anymore, but I keep it anyway:
# Clone the Play repo
#git clone -o origin https://github.com/playframework/playframework.git playframework
```

TITLE: Downloading Play Framework Modules via curl
DESCRIPTION: Series of curl commands to download Play Framework modules from the Typesafe repository. The commands use GET requests to fetch specific versions of the Rythm module and external configuration module, saving them with their respective version numbers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-10_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -X GET https://downloads.typesafe.com/play1/modules/rythm-1.0.0-20121110a.zip -o rythm-1.0.0-20121110a.zip
curl -X GET https://downloads.typesafe.com/play1/modules/rythm-1.0.0-20121128.zip -o rythm-1.0.0-20121128.zip
curl -X GET https://downloads.typesafe.com/play1/modules/rythm-1.0.0-20121210.zip -o rythm-1.0.0-20121210.zip
curl -X GET https://downloads.typesafe.com/play1/modules/externalconfig-0.2.zip -o externalconfig-0.2.zip
```

TITLE: Defining Community Process in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: A markdown document that details the community process for Play Framework, including project ownership, roles, decision making procedures, and rules for integrators.
SOURCE: https://github.com/playframework/playframework.com/blob/main/public/markdown/community-process.md#2025-04-10_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Community Process

The purpose of this page is to make transparent the process by which decisions are made in Play Framework.  This is not a set of laws governing the Play project, nor is anything in this document new, it simply acknowledges the process that is already in place, and documents what it is.

The goal of this page is to increase community contribution and sense of ownership over the Play project, through doing the following:

* Making it clear and transparent to people who are new to the Play community how decisions are made, who makes those decisions, and how new people can attain any decision making responsibility.
* Providing a concrete definition of the decision making process in Play, so that it can be referred to and improved upon, should the need arise.

## Project ownership

The Play project source code is licensed under the Apache 2 License.  The steering committee has the final say on both product decisions and technical decisions for the project.

Though the steering committee has the final say in any decisions made, the Play community, with over 400 community contributors to the core of Play, and hundreds more to the broader Play ecosystem, is arguably just as important, if not more important, than the Play project itself.

For this reason, the steering committee's relationship to the Play project is best described as a stewardship, the steering committee manages the Play project, but is held accountable by the Play community.

For more details on the steering committee see the [Sponsors page](https://www.playframework.com/sponsors).
```
